Package OOPVersion

Class Mastermind

java.lang.Object
OOPVersion.Game
OOPVersion.Mastermind
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Mastermind extends OOPVersion.Game implements Serializable
A class that defines a game of Mastermind
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Mastermind

      public Mastermind(OOPVersion.Player[] players, int numberGames, int numberGuesses, String version)
      Mastermind 4 argument constructor. Calls 4 mutators from the super class Game
      Parameters:
      players - the two game players
      numberGames - the number of games set by the human player
      numberGuesses - the number of guesses set by the human player
      version - the game version chosen by the human player

  • Method Details

    • getPlayButtonEventCount

      public static int getPlayButtonEventCount()
      method to count how many times the set player button was pressed to ensure that the players names were set
      Returns:
      int value specifying count

    • getGuessButtonEventCount

      public static int getGuessButtonEventCount()
      method to count how many times the Guess button was pressed to ensure game can be played
      Returns:
      int value specifying count

    • setGuessButtonEventCount

      public static void setGuessButtonEventCount(int guessButtonEventCount)
      method to set how many times the Guess button was pressed to ensure game can be played
      Parameters:
      guessButtonEventCount - the number times the guess button is pressed

    • setGuessButtonSet

      public static void setGuessButtonSet(boolean guessButtonSet)
      method to set the Guess Button to true (pressed) or false (not pressed)
      Parameters:
      guessButtonSet - whether the Guess Button has been set or not

    • setGameButtonSet

      public static void setGameButtonSet(boolean gameButtonSet)
      method to set the Game Button to true (pressed) or false (not pressed)
      Parameters:
      gameButtonSet - whether the Game Button has been set or not

    • getPegColourList

      public static ArrayList<Color> getPegColourList()
      method to get the colours that cane be used in the game
      Returns:
      Array list of colours that can be used in the game

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method where the pegColourList is initialised. This is also where the first GUI is created using four methods (createStartButton(), createLoadButton(), createViewLeaderboardButton(), createQuitButton()) There are also Key Listeners connected to the four buttons
      Parameters:
      args - main String

    • createStartButton

      private static JButton createStartButton()
      The method to create the 'START GAME' button.
      Returns:
      A JButton that has a mouse listener connected which calls the chooseGameOptions() method

    • createLoadButton

      private static JButton createLoadButton()
      The method to create the 'LOAD GAME' button.
      Returns:
      A JButton that has a mouse listener connected which calls the File method to load the last saved game.

    • createViewLeaderboardButton

      private static JButton createViewLeaderboardButton()
      The method to create the 'VIEW LEADERBOARD' button.
      Returns:
      A JButton that has a mouse listener connected which calls the File method to load the leaderboard.

    • createQuitButton

      private static JButton createQuitButton()
      The method to create the 'QUIT' button.
      Returns:
      A JButton that has a mouse listener connected which exits the game if confirmed by the user.

    • chooseGameOptions

      private static void chooseGameOptions()
      The method to create the Player and Game options GUI. Here the amount of players, player names, game type (kids, classic or expert), max number of guesses and max number of games are set. There are itemListeners connected to each radio button to determine game type and player amount. There is a button to confirm player amount, a button to confirm Number of Games,a button to confirm Number of Guesses and finally a button to confirm all the choices made

    • createGameBoard

      private static JPanel createGameBoard()
      The method to create the left side of the game board where the guess and hints buttons are located. There is also a solution panel where the solution will be displayed at the end of the game or when the game is won.
      Returns:
      A JPanel that makes the left side of the game board

    • createPlayBoard

      private static JPanel createPlayBoard()
      The method to create the right side of the game board where the game colour options, guess panel and submit guess button are located. There is also a save button with a mouseListener to save the current state of the game.
      Returns:
      A JPanel that makes the right side of the game board

    • createGuessPanels

      private static JPanel createGuessPanels()
      The method to create the guess panels on the left side of the board game. This method will be called after each game to 'reset' the guess buttons
      Returns:
      A JPanel that has four grey buttons

    • createHintsPanels

      private static JPanel createHintsPanels()
      The method to create the hint panels on the left side of the board game. This method will be called after each game to 'reset' the hint buttons
      Returns:
      A JPanel that has four grey buttons

    • playGAME

      private static void playGAME()
      The method where the game is 'Code Maker' and 'Code Breaker' are set. The game direction is set here, dependent on the factors chose in the chooseGameOptions() method

    • gameGUI

      private static JFrame gameGUI()
      The method where the game is 'Code Maker' and 'Code Breaker' are set. The game direction is set here, dependent on the factors chose in the chooseGameOptions() method
      Returns:
      JFrame with the main Game board GUI

    • createCodeComputer

      private static Color[] createCodeComputer()
      The method where 'code' is created by the CPU Player
      Returns:
      Color array that represents the solution created by the CPU Player

    • createCodeHuman

      private static Color[] createCodeHuman(JButton[] codeColorButtons)
      The method where the 'code' is created by the Human Player
      Parameters:
      codeColorButtons - Buttons representing code chosen by human player
      Returns:
      Color array that represents the solution created by the Human Player

    • createCodePicker

      private static JPanel createCodePicker()
      The method that creates the GUI where the Human Player can choose the colours they want to set as the 'code'
      Returns:
      JPanel that has the colours available to choose and a button to set those colours as the solution

    • numberValidator

      private static int numberValidator(String s)
      The method checks the input for the 'Number of Games' and 'Number of Guesses' text field is a number between 1 and 10
      Parameters:
      s - the String to be validated by the method
      Returns:
      an int between 1 and 10 that is used to set the text field to the updated and correct number

    • compareCode

      private static Color[] compareCode(Color[] g, Color[] s)
      The method compares the solution code and the guess code to appropriately set the hint 'pegs'
      Parameters:
      g - the color array representing the guess colour code
      s - the color array representing the solution colour code
      Returns:
      a Color array that is used to set the hint 'pegs' to the correct colours dependent on the game version

    • checkWin

      public static boolean checkWin(Color[] h)
      The method that checks if the hint 'pegs' are all set to 'RED' which indicates a win.
      Parameters:
      h - the color array representing the hint colour 'pegs'
      Returns:
      a boolean which determines whether the game has been won.
